properties.areaDesc: Hawk Channel from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out to the reef; Straits of Florida from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge 20 to 60 NM out; Hawk Channel from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out to the reef; Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and Buttonwood Sound; Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to Craig Key 20 to 60 NM out; Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out 20 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 31 at 11:55PM EST until February 1 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Key West has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Hawk Channel and Straits of Florida from Ocean Reef to west end of
Seven Mile Bridge out 60 nm...
Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and
Buttonwood Sound...

* Until 100 AM EST.

* At 1154 PM EST, strong thunderstorms with possible waterspouts were
located along a line extending from near Pacific Reef to 7 nm
southeast of Spiegel Grove to Islamorada Hump to near Marathon
Humps, moving east at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats, cause
considerable damage to vessels and create suddenly higher
waves. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34 knots, suddenly
higher waves, frequent lightning, and heavy downpours.

* Locations in the warning include...
Mosquito Bank Light, Islamorada Hump, French Ref, 409 Humps,
Floyd's Wall Southwest, Grecian Rocks and Alligator Reef Light.
properties.instruction:
Boaters should seek safe harbor now, and remain there until
threatening weather has passed.

Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If caught on the
open water, stay low or go below.
